subject: Re: [junit] Problem with JUnit3.6 and VisualAge 3.5
msgSnippet: if you are using package, you need to call the class with package name. ex.: assume that you have the following directory /home/user/xyz_suite/testsuite.java,
messageBody:
if you are using package, you need to call the class with package name.

ex.:

assume that you have the following directory

/home/user/xyz_suite/testsuite.java, testcase.java

in testsuite.java and testcase.java you are using package xyz_suite
and calling the test case from testsuite.java

you need to set the class path to /home/user/

$/home/user/xyz_suite/java junit.textui.TestRunner xyz_suite.testsuite

regards,
Bhavani.

"Johannes O. Akinlaja" wrote:

Did you add the project to the class path?
----- Original Message -----
From: Frédéric BEAUDREE
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, May 15, 2001 6:18 PM
Subject: [junit] Problem with JUnit3.6 and VisualAge 3.5
 Hi, I want to use JUnit 3.6 in VisualAge 3.5, but there is an error when I launch a test using a class localized in an other projet than my test class project. The exception raised is a NoClassDefFoundError. Is this problem known ? Thanks, Fred
